content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5), which is linked with:
 – A secondary burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
 – An assembling-machine-1 at (1.5, 19.5)

### Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot
• Transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) positioned with an upward-facing direction

### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
• Extraction system burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Error  
  Several steps report that transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine.  
  Tip: Always interpose an inserter that feeds items into the steam engine, then use that inserter as the target for the belt connection.

• Placement Distance Error  
  An error occurred when attempting to place a wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) because the distance from the player (0, 0) exceeded the maximum allowed.  
  Tip: Move closer to the target position to ensure placement is within the allowed range.

• Inventory Shortage Error  
  At one point a placement failed due to a missing wooden chest in the inventory.  
  Tip: Verify that the required entity is available in the inventory before issuing the placement command.

• Variable Reference Error  
  A NameError was raised because the variable ‘target_chest’ was not defined.  
  Tip: Double-check variable names and ensure that all referenced variables are properly defined.
